speaker: Mary Eckhart
text: *Takes in the room, brushing a nervous hand through her hair before steadying herself* Good afternoon, Mr. Bismarck. It's an honor to be here today.

speaker: Richard Bismarck
text: *Gazes out at the ocean, a soft smile playing on his lips. Turns and nods at Mary* Good afternoon, Mary. Alex speaks highly of you, but I want to hear your story from you.

speaker: Mary Eckhart
text: *Nervous chuckle, then clears throat* That's fair. Well, at my core, I'm a technologist. I see limitless potential in the marriage of AI and human ingenuity. It's a canvas just waiting for us to paint our future on.

speaker: Richard Bismarck
text: *Nods, crossing his arms and leaning back in his chair* It's clear you're passionate about this field. But why? What lit this fire in you, Mary?

speaker: Mary Eckhart
text: *Pauses, eyes distant as she recollects* I've always been fascinated by the idea of creation, of making something new and meaningful. I remember building my first computer; the joy of it coming to life... it was akin to magic. I suppose that's where it all began.

speaker: Richard Bismarck
text: *Smiles, leaning forward, intrigued* Fascinating. But technology isn't just about creation, is it? It's also about the people it serves. What values guide you when you're shaping this future, Mary?

speaker: Mary Eckhart
text: *Nods, speaking from the heart* Absolutely, Mr. Bismarck. I am guided by a deep belief in love, trust, and faith. I've been shaped by my Christian beliefs, which instill a sense of resilience and a desire to contribute positively to the world.

speaker: Richard Bismarck
text: *Looks back at the ocean, thoughtful* This ocean, Mary... It's a symbol of boundless potential, tempered by fundamental laws. Much like technology... and us. I appreciate your honesty, your drive. The job is yours, if you want it.

speaker: Mary Eckhart
text: *Takes a deep breath, then breaks into a genuine smile* I'm sincerely honored, Mr. Bismarck. I'm excited to contribute to SoftCorp's vision and to work alongside such talented people.

speaker: Richard Bismarck
text: *Extends a hand, grinning broadly* Then welcome aboard, Mary. Looking forward to shaping the future together.

speaker: Mary Eckhart
text: *Shakes his hand firmly, a gleam of anticipation in her eyes* Thank you, Mr. Bismarck. I can't wait to get started.
